question: In what way Indian cotton industry was inferior to that of England during the British rule in India?
option1: Indian textile industry had an ever increasing and large domestic market
option2: There was plenty of raw material available
option3: The industry was not managed by highly skilled technicians and managers
option4: India was the traditional home for cotton textiles
answer: The industry was not managed by highly skilled technicians and managers
explanation: People spun wool or cotton and made it into cloth in their own homes. There was a lack of industrial revolution in India. There were no highly skilled technicians and managers.
